sdnn: SDNN (Standard Deviation of NN intervals) – Measures overall HRV, lower values indicate higher stress.
rmssd: RMSSD (Root Mean Square of Successive Differences) – Measures short-term HRV, lower values suggest increased stress.
pnn50: PNN50 (Percentage of NN50) – The percentage of successive RR intervals differing by more than 50 ms, lower values indicate higher stress.
bvps: BVPs (Blood Volume Pulse signals) – Measures blood volume changes in microvascular tissue, commonly obtained via photoplethysmography (PPG) for heart rate and stress analysis.
bpms: BPMs (Beats Per Minute) – Represents the number of heartbeats per minute, used to monitor cardiovascular health and detect anomalies.
nni_seq: NNI_SEQ (Normal-to-Normal Interval Sequence) – A sequence of time intervals between consecutive normal heartbeats, crucial for heart rate variability (HRV) analysis and stress detection.
